remarks: Define the class of orthoposets, which are bounded posets with an orthocomplementation operation.  Note that ` ( Base ` p ) e. dom ( lub ` p ) ` means there is an upper bound ` 1. ` , and similarly for the ` 0. ` element.  (Contributed by NM, 20-Oct-2011.)  (Revised by NM, 13-Sep-2018.)
statement:
df-oposet $p |- OP = { p e. Poset | ( ( ( Base ` p ) e. dom ( lub ` p ) /\ ( Base ` p ) e. dom ( glb ` p ) ) /\ E. o ( o = ( oc ` p ) /\ A. a e. ( Base ` p ) A. b e. ( Base ` p ) ( ( ( o ` a ) e. ( Base ` p ) /\ ( o ` ( o ` a ) ) = a /\ ( a ( le ` p ) b -> ( o ` b ) ( le ` p ) ( o ` a ) ) ) /\ ( a ( join ` p ) ( o ` a ) ) = ( 1. ` p ) /\ ( a ( meet ` p ) ( o ` a ) ) = ( 0. ` p ) ) ) ) } $.
$d a b o p $.
